alert.note: Alert for Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 8:44PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Stonewall County through 915 PM CDT... At 843 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Aspermont, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects and vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Aspermont, Old Glory, Swenson, and Us-380 Near The Haskell- Stonewall County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
